subject: Law
title: Trade Secret vs. Patent: The Strategic Choice
description: A 60-second lesson on Trade Secret vs. Patent: The Strategic Choice.

hook.text: Coca-Cola chose secrecy. Pharmaceutical companies choose patents. Both protect valuable inventions differently.

buildup.text: Patents require disclosure but give strong, enforceable rights. Trade secrets need no disclosure but are fragile.

discovery.text: If your invention can be reverse-engineered, a patent is smarter. If it can't, a trade secret may last longer.

twist.text: You can't have both. Filing a patent publishes the invention, destroying any trade secret protection.

climax.text: Google's search algorithm is a trade secret. Its patents cover specific technical methods, not the whole system.

punchline.text: Patent means share and protect. Trade secret means hide and hope.

quiz.question: When is a trade secret better than a patent?
options: When the invention can't be reverse-engineered
